EmailTemplate.description: Channel Partner Queue Receives Notifies Partner Users of New Lead
EmailTemplate.name: Channel Partner Queue Receives Notifies Partner Users of New Lead
EmailTemplate.subject: New {!Lead.OwnerFullName} Lead in the Queue
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Lead.OwnerFullName},
We’re excited to inform you that our marketing efforts have led to a marketing qualified lead. The lead, {!Lead.Lead_Number__c}, is in the “leads inbox” for you to review.
This lead will be assigned to the first channel partner who “accepts” the lead—first come, first served. Once the lead is accepted, it will be automatically assigned to you.
Once the lead is assigned to you, please update the status in the next 10 days from marketing qualified lead (MQL) to sales accepted lead (SAL) to let us know you’re working this deal. Any leads not actioned in 10 days will be forfeited and resubmitted back to the queue.
After you update the lead status to SAL, you’re expected to update the status of the lead as it progresses using the following designations::
Sales Qualified:
o A lead that has evolved into a qualified pipeline opportunity.
· Recycle:
o Lead needs to be sent back to marketing because they are not ready to buy, but the lead needs to remain active. Requirement may arise at a future date (e.g. due mandate).
· Disqualified:
o Lead is not appropriate or viable; incorrect contact info, not our target market, lead is from a student or job seeker or customer is not interested.
· Converted:
o Lead is successfully closed and won.
Thank you for your cooperation
The Honeywell Marketing Team
